jsdoc_comments.details: All new functions and constants have proper JSDoc comments: POLLING_INTERVALS, getPollingInterval, WorktreeSelectionProvider, useWorktreeSelection

naming_conventions.details: Consistent naming: constants in UPPER_SNAKE_CASE, functions in camelCase, types in PascalCase

dead_code.details: No dead code found. All imports are used. Old WORKTREE_POLLING_INTERVAL_MS constant does not exist in source code (only in design documents).

separation_of_concerns.details: Clear section structure: Constants, Helper Functions, Types, Context, Reducer, Provider, Hook

kiss_principle.details: Implementation is simple and straightforward. getPollingInterval uses clear priority-based logic.

error_handling.details: Appropriate error handling in polling effect with fallback to SESSION_RUNNING interval on error

type_safety.details: TypeScript strict mode passes. All types are properly defined.

quality_improvements.code_quality_notes: Code is well-structured and follows best practices. No refactoring required.

test_verification.details: All 13 tests for WorktreeSelectionContext pass including 5 new tests for getPollingInterval

summary: The implementation for Issue #35 (dynamic polling interval) is clean and well-structured. The code follows SOLID principles (especially Single Responsibility and Open/Closed), KISS, and DRY. No refactoring changes were needed. The implementation correctly exports POLLING_INTERVALS constant and getPollingInterval function, both with comprehensive JSDoc documentation. The polling effect uses setTimeout for adaptive intervals based on worktree activity states. All tests pass with 97.1% coverage.
